attributes.action: enforce the leisure and travel industry to standardise the age of a child
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
When is a child an Adult? Across the leisure/travel industry the age of a child varies. Examples as follows*
Chessington World of Adventures Adult prices at 12 years of age
British Airways Adult prices at 12 years of age 
Thomas Cook Adult prices at 13 years of age
EasyJet Adult prices at 15 years of age
P&O Ferries Adult at 16 years of age
Ryanair Adult prices at 16 years of age
Cosmos Holiday Adult prices at 16 years of age

Isn’t a child deemed to be child until he/she reaches their 18th birthday under the Children’s Act 1989

How can it be right to class a 12 year old as an adult and charge adult rates accordingly. 

Please show your support by signing this petition  


*information gathered from the relevant companies websites on the 10/08/07
